articles.title: Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to February 8 Vinalon Complex
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to February 8 Vinalon Complex
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, provided field guidance to the February 8 Vinalon Complex alive with a high-pitched drive for increased production.
					
					After being briefed on the progress made in the project for expanding its production capacity before a large long-term plan, he went round the vertical spinning shop, the converting shop and other places of the complex to learn about the production there.
					
					He expressed great satisfaction over the fact that the workers of the complex have made uninterrupted leaping advances, not resting content with their achievements, thereby completing in a brief span of time the vast project which would have taken several years at an ordinary pace and opening a bright prospect for starting production.
					
					He highly praised its officials, workers and technicians for having performed feats, noting with appreciation that they have rapidly boosted the vinalon production and radically improved the quality of vinalon fiber.
					
					Watching vinalon being churned out in an endless stream from spinners, converters and drawing machines, he said the quality of vinalon cotton is improving day by day. Our people can now benefit from vinalon, he added.
					
					He watched workers converting vinalon with good care for a long while and extended a warm salute to the workers of the complex working hard to produce quality clothing materials for people. 
					
					He said the most important task facing the complex is to keep the production going at a high rate on the basis of the solid material and technological foundation. 
					
					He expressed expectation and belief that the workers of the complex would fully display the might of the complex as a model one of the Juche-oriented industry of the country. 
					
					He was accompanied by Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., WPK; Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC; Thae Jong Su, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., WPK; Hyon Chol Hae, department director of the NDC; and Kwak Pom Gi, chief secretary of the South Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the WPK.

articles.title: Open Letter to U.S. and S. Korean Authorities
articles.content:
Open Letter to U.S. and S. Korean Authorities
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- The United States and the south Korean authorities are contemplating staging again adventurous Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises from August 16 to 26 despite the unanimous desire of the people at home and abroad for peace on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					In view of such situation sparking another danger of war on the peninsula, the Panmunjom Mission of the Korean People's Army Sunday sent the U.S. and the south Korean authorities the following open letter reflecting the unanimous will of the army and the people of the DPRK:
					
					Peace is the strong desire and invariable requirement of the army and the people of the DPRK.
					
					It is, however, long since the situation on the peninsula inched close to a touch-and-go situation, after going beyond the fragile state of armistice.
					
					Such trend of the situation is attributable to the hostile policy enforced by the U.S. toward the DPRK, failing to match its words with its deeds and the anti-DPRK policy of confrontation followed by the south Korean authorities, toeing its line. It is, at the same time, a direct product of the evermore undisguised war hysteria kicked up by the military warmongers against the north, pursuant to it.
					
					The Ulji Freedom Guardian is part of this hysteria for a war of aggression against the north.
					
					This can be explained by the fact that the projected joint saber-rattling will be dangerous war maneuvers to be staged by the U.S. and the south Korean military warmongers in accordance with newly revised and supplemented war scenario against the north. This can also be evidenced by the fact that the projected joint exercises would be all-out nuclear war maneuvers involving modern war hardware including improved nuclear attack means and huge aggressor forces and even local administrative organs and non-governmental enterprises.
					
					What should not go unnoticed is the fact that they are going to stage such reckless saber-rattling though they must know well the resentment and hatred of the servicepersons and people of the DPRK and their determination to take revenge upon the military warmongers of south Korea for their hideous provocations are running high.
					
					The KPA Panmunjom Mission is authorized to raise the following principled demands to the U.S. and the south Korean authorities in view of the prevailing grave situation:
					
					1. The U.S. and the south Korean authorities should show the DPRK the will for the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula by making a bold policy decision to cancel the projected joint military exercises.
					
					If they stage actions of blackmailing against the other party by mobilizing even the group of super-large nuclear aircraft carrier and strategic nuclear strike flying corps, while urging someone to show sincere attitude towards denuclearization, this will amount to breaching the principle of simultaneous action for denuclearization. 
					
					The denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula cannot be achieved by denuclearizing one side only.
					
					This should be comprehensive and fair denuclearization including the removal of nuclear threats to the DPRK.
					
					The army and people of the DPRK are not what they used to be in the past. They do not hide that they have had access to nuclear deterrent powerful enough to protect themselves.
					
					If the other party launches a nuclear war, the DPRK is ready to counter it with nukes. It is its solemn declaration.
					
					The U.S. and the south Korean authorities had better face up to the changed situation and properly understand who their rival is. They should show their willingness to denuclearize the peninsula in the eyes of the world by canceling the projected nuclear war exercises.
					
					2. By canceling the exercises the U.S. and the south Korean authorities should make a bold practical decision to replace the armistice system by a peace-keeping mechanism on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					War and peace can never go together.
					
					Nothing is more shameless political artifice than showing such poor double-dealing tactics as making preparations for a war behind the scene while paying lip-service to peace and dialogue.
					
					The annual repetition of such war provocation actions as the Ulji Freedom Guardian would only keep the evil cycle of mistrust and confrontation and this is bound to lead to a war.
					
					The U.S. and south Korea are gravely mistaken if they think they would remain safe in case of a war on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					If a war breaks out, the DPRK will lose the military demarcation line and gain national reunification, the cherished desire of the nation. The DPRK is full of confidence and optimism about it.
					
					If the U.S. has true willingness to replace the armistice system by a peace-keeping mechanism, it should show its practical willingness to do so at home and abroad as a big power by canceling the joint military maneuvers for this year at least.
					
					3. The U.S. and the south Korean authorities should officially show their willingness to normalize the DPRK-U.S. relations and the inter-Korean relations by canceling the projected joint military exercises.
					
					The normalization process should begin with ending the hostile relations.
					
					To call for reconciliation, cooperation and improvement of relations and then to stage war exercises to do harm to the other side would be the height of double-dealing tactics.
					
					The U.S. incurred the towering grudge of Koreans and the south Korean authorities ruined the June 15 era, bringing untold pain to the people. But the army and people of the DPRK are ready to subordinate everything to the great cause of peace, reunification, reconciliation and cooperation.
					
					The U.S. and the south Korean authorities should no longer commit such a policy error as misjudging the will of the DPRK.
					
					Upcoming August 15 is supposed to offer a new watershed for the improvement of the relations between the north and the south. In the light of the public expectation for this, it would mean the total denial of the improvement of the relations if they start the joint military exercises against the DPRK from Aug. 16. 
					
					Frankly speaking, as far as the issue of improving the DPRK-U.S. relations and the inter-Korean relations is concerned, the U.S. and south Korea is more pressed for time than the DPRK.
					
					The DPRK has so far followed its path without having had its relations normalized with the U.S. and south Korea and it will thrive and live better off in the future, too.
					
					They must officially make public their willingness to cancel the military exercises targeted against the army and people of the DPRK, if they want to normalize the relations with the DPRK.
					
					The army and people of the DPRK remain unchanged in their will and stand to counter the said exercises with the toughest stand.
					
					The U.S. and the south Korean authorities should behave with discretion, cogitate and choose a wise way-out at the crossroads of dialogue or confrontation and peace or war.
					
					The army and people of the DPRK look forward to a positive response to their just call.

articles.title: Chinese Flotilla Leaves Wonsan Port of DPRK
articles.content:
Chinese Flotilla Leaves Wonsan Port of DPRK
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- The flotilla of the Navy of the Chinese People's Liberation Army headed by Vice Admiral Tian Zhong, commander of the North Sea Fleet of the Navy, left Wonsan Port Monday after its goodwill visit to the DPRK.
					
					The flotilla consists of training ship "Zheng He" and frigate "Luoyang".

articles.title: Greetings to Singaporean FM
articles.content:
Greetings to Singaporean FM
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- Pak Ui Chun, foreign minister of the DPRK, on Monday sent a message of greeting to K. Shanmugam, foreign minister of Singapore, on its national day.
					
					Pak in the message wished him greater success in his work, expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between two countries would continue to develop favorably in mutual interests.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Singapore
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Singapore
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greeting to S. R. Nathan, president of Singapore, on Monday on its 46th national day.
					
					Kim in the message wished for the prosperity of Singapore, expressing the belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to develop.

articles.title: Delegation of Kim Chaek University of Technology Leaves for China
articles.content:
Delegation of Kim Chaek University of Technology Leaves for China
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- A delegation of Kim Chaek University of Technology headed by President Hong So Hon Monday left here to participate in the opening ceremony of the 26th World University Summer Games (Universiad) and the world forum of the university presidents which are to be held in Shenzhen, China.

articles.title: Europeans Want to See DPRK for Themselves: Company Official
articles.content:
Europeans Want to See DPRK for Themselves: Company Official
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- Hannah Barraclough, operations manager of Koryo Tours, a UK travel company, was interviewed by KCNA on Saturday, before leaving Pyongyang.
					
					Question: Is this the first time for you to visit the DPRK?
					
					Answer: I've visited nearly 70 times. I'm working for a Beijing-based travel company founded in 1993. Our work is to bring foreign tourists to your country, the DPRK.
					
					Question: The name of your company sounds meaningful. Why is your company named after Koryo? 
					
					Answer: We chose the word "Koryo" because it has a lot of meanings to the people in the DPRK. And we know that it was the name of the first unified dynasty here and also because our company runs only for tourism in the DPRK. So we wanted to choose the name very special to the Korean people.
					
					Question: Can you tell me about tourists' impressions of the DPRK?
					
					Answer: They are very happy to be able to come and hear for themselves the story of your country and the history of your country. The West media sometimes portray the DPRK in a different way, so it is very good to be able to come and hear for themselves and hear from the Korean people.
					
					Question: What are tourists interested in?
					
					Answer: They are very interested in visiting places which have a lot of meanings for the Korean people and also especially in visiting somewhere like DMZ (Demilitarized Zone) and Panmunjom because they are able to see for themselves the division of your country and see how tragic it is.
					
					Question: How many tourists has your company brought to the DPRK from the beginning of the year?
					
					Answer: We had around 500 tourists this year and we expect by the end of the year to have around 1 400 tourists.
					
					Question: Will you give me your impressions of the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang"?
					
					Answer: Very, very interesting. That is one of the highlights of their trip to the DPRK. And there is nothing else like this in the world. They find it utterly breathtaking, very, very specially prepared.
					
					Question: What do you think your company can do for the improvement of relations between the DPRK and UK?
					
					Answer: We are trying to do that. We have already made several films about the DPRK and we are making a film which would be finished this year. We're to develop the cultural exchange. For example, last year we brought a British women's football team to the DPRK to play football matches and next year we hope to take the DPRK team to Europe.

articles.title: Long Live Great General Kim Jong Il: S. Korean Prisoner
articles.content:
Long Live Great General Kim Jong Il: S. Korean Prisoner
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- The south Korean daily Dong-A Ilbo August 5 carried an article saying a south Korean prisoner, 43, shouted "Long live great General Kim Jong Il!" at a lawcourt when his sentence was reduced.
					
					The article says:
					
					On June 30 this year, the man, surnamed Hwang, was taken to court No. 410 of Suwon District Court, for the final hearing of the appeal after being charged with violation of the National Security Law (NSL).
					
					He was arrested in December 2010 and brought to justice on suspicion that he posted some 380 materials and 6 videos praising the north's social system on a website in August 2007.
					
					In the final trial, his sentence was reduced to one year from one and half year.
					
					The moment the judge was coming out of the court room, Hwang abruptly shouted "Long live great General Kim Jong Il!" looking squarely at the prosecutor.
					
					The Kyonggi Provincial Police launched a re-investigation of Hwang's case in a bid to charge him with violation of NSL prohibiting praises of the north.
					
					During the interrogation, he said, "I wanted to speak highly of the north in the court and I did it on the trial day because I thought it was an appropriate day. If what I did is reported by media and known to young people and generations to come, I will be remembered as a praiseworthy man."
					
					"My homeland is north Korea, and south Korea is governed by a puppet regime. I think the six-month reduction is a shame to me".
					
					Hwang, a university graduate, was employed by a big construction business. The police was surprised by an ordinary worker unhesitatingly praising the north and slandering the south.
					
					After a month-long investigation, the police again made a non-restraint arrest of Hwang on August 1 for his intention to praise the north.
					
					The head of the first investigation group of the Kyonggi Provincial Police Agency, Pak Tal Sun, said, "Prisoners speaking highly of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and north Korea in court are on increase."

articles.title: War Victory Day of DPRK Celebrated Abroad
articles.content:
War Victory Day of DPRK Celebrated Abroad
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- Events took place in China and Pakistan to mark the 58th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					There were a photo, book and fine art exhibition in Mudanjiang City, Heilongjiang Province of China and a seminar and a film show in Karachi, Pakistan on July 30. 
					
					Displayed at the exhibition hall were photos showing leader Kim Jong Il's visit to China and Korean books and fine art works. 
					
					The chairman of the Pakistan Association for Self-Reliance Studies and other speakers at the seminar stressed the historic significance of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War, saying that thanks to the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung the heroic Korean people could defend the sovereignty and dignity of the country from the military invasion by the U.S. imperialists. 
					
					The immortal exploits of the President, who shattered the myth of "mightiness" of the U.S. imperialists and brought about the beginning of decline for them with his Juche-based military idea, strategy and tactics, matchless pluck and extraordinary commanding art, would remain long in history, they said. 
					
					Under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il the DPRK has turned into a powerful socialist country any formidable enemy dare not provoke and the Korean people have displayed their dignity as victorious people, they noted.
					
					They expressed support and solidarity with the Korean people in their just struggle to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country without any outsiders' interference. 
					
					Appreciated at the show was a Korean film dealing with the invincible might of the Korean People's Army. 
					
					A message of greeting to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the event in Pakistan.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Works Posted on Guinean Internet Website
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Works Posted on Guinean Internet Website
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- The Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea on August 2 posted on its Internet homepage the full texts of President Kim Il Sung's works. The works are "On the Three Principles of National Reunification", "10-Point Programme of the Great Unity of the Whole Nation for the Reunification of the Country" and "3. Let Us Reunify the Country Independently and Peacefully" from "Report to the Sixth Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea on the Work of the Central Committee".
					
					The homepage also carried a photo of the Three Charters for National Reunification Memorial Tower.

articles.title: Iranian Paper Marks Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work
articles.content:
Iranian Paper Marks Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- The Iranian paper Iran News on August 3 dedicated an article titled "The Immortal Great Program for Korea's Reunification" to the 14th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification."
					
					In the work Kim Jong Il formulated as the three charters for Korea's reunification the three principles of national reunification, the ten-point program of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo advanced by President Kim Il Sung, the article noted. 
					
					He also indicated the concrete tasks and ways for realizing the reunification, it said, adding:
					
					They include matters of settling the problem of Korea's reunification on the basis of the principle of national independence, achieving the great national unity on the principle of giving priority to the common interests of the nation, realizing Korea's reunification in a peaceful way, founding a national unified state by means of federation and improving the north-south relations.
					
					The work has displayed its great might in realizing the cause of Korea's reunification over the last 14 years. 
					
					Amid growing desire of the Koreans to settle the reunification issue on the principles of national independence and great national unity as clarified in the work, the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and its action program the October 4 declaration were adopted and a new era of national independent reunification was opened in which the Koreans work hard to achieve national reunification closely rallied in the idea of "By our nation itself". 
					
					The Korean nation's desire for reunification will be surely realized when it thoroughly defends and implements the said declarations, embodiment of the three charters for national reunification.

articles.title: Complete Collection of Kim Il Sung's Works Off Press in DPRK
articles.content:
Complete Collection of Kim Il Sung's Works Off Press in DPRK
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House brought out Vol. 97 of "Complete Collection of Kim Il Sung's Works", a library of the immortal Juche idea which systematically and comprehensively carries his works in the chronological order. 
					
					Contained in the book is Vol. 3 of President Kim Il Sung's reminiscences "With the Century".
					
					It deals with the undying feats, precious experience and great personality of the President who developed into a new higher stage the overall Korean revolution centered on the anti-Japanese armed struggle, breaking through difficulties in the period from February 1933 to February 1935.
					
					In "Chapter 7 The People's World" the President recollected the days when he built the guerilla bases along the shore of the River Tuman into a genuine land for people's happy life and a strategic stronghold for the Korean revolution and led the work to found a semi-guerrilla zone in vast areas of east Manchuria and homeland. 
					
					"Chapter 8 Under the Banner of the Anti-Japanese Struggle" tells about the facts that he achieved the united front with Chinese anti-Japanese units and aroused all the guerrillas and people in the Xiaowangqing guerrilla base to victory in the battle to protect the base.
					
					"Chapter 9 The First Expedition to North Manchuria" deals with the fact that he conducted the first expedition to north Manchuria to strengthen the combined front with anti-Japanese armed units in this area and foil the Japanese' imperialists' siege-and-attack operation.

articles.title: New Books Available at Grand People's Study House
articles.content:
New Books Available at Grand People's Study House
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il sent over 150 volumes of some 130 books and magazines of different languages to the Grand People's Study House in July.
					
					They are medical science, music, cooking, mechanical engineering and architecture books.
					
					The medical books include "Reference Book about Diabetes" and "Most Efficacious Natural Therapies". 
					
					"Harmony Analysis", "Hearing" and other music books are necessary for enhancing the scientific and theoretical level of art education and improving experts' artistic ability and students' basic knowledge of music.  
					
					The cooking books introduce diets for diabetes and cancer.
					
					Some of the new books and magazines deal with advanced architectural engineering technology and building materials.
					
					The books and reference materials sent to the study house by Kim Jong Il from beginning of this year total 2 570 volumes of 1 480 kinds.

articles.title: Boxing Coaching Course Held in DPRK
articles.content:
Boxing Coaching Course Held in DPRK
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- An Olympic solidarity boxing coaching course was held at Pyongyang Indoor Stadium recently.
					
					The course was attended by boxing experts, including coaches and teachers from sports teams and juvenile sports schools in Pyongyang.
					
					The course dealt with training means of boxers and their application and matters concerning the improvement of coaches' quality.
					
					A lecturer from the International Amateur Boxing Association officiated at the course.

articles.title: Performance of New Drama Goes On
articles.content:
Performance of New Drama Goes On
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- The performance of the drama "We Will Recollect Today" is going on in Pyongyang, drawing many people. 
					
					The drama is based on strenuous efforts made by people in a mountainous county to build a minor power station in the period when the country was in hard time. 
					
					In the period the Korean people suffered from food shortage caused by repeated natural disasters and the imperialists' economic sanctions and some of the industrial establishments found it difficult to operate themselves. 
					
					The Korean people, however, turned out in the effort for the prosperity of the country under the slogan "Let Us Go the Thorny Path Cheerfully!", encouraged by leader Kim Jong Il's aphorism "Let Us Live not Merely for Today but for Tomorrow".
					
					They constructed many things, surmounting all difficulties, with the belief that their makings would contribute to the prosperity of the country.
					
					Soldiers built a handsome recreation ground in Mt. Kuwol and carved letters "For the future. 1997, the last year of hardship" on a rock.
					
					The Korean people's strenuous efforts led to the production of vinalon, steel and fertilizers based on domestic raw materials and cutting-edge technologies.
					
					They are now striving hard to build a thriving nation.

articles.title: Acupuncture and Moxibustion Develop in DPRK
articles.content:
Acupuncture, Moxibustion Develop in DPRK
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- Acupuncture and moxibustion, the Korean people's traditional therapies, are widely used in many countries. 
					
					They have brought many changes to medical treatment.
					
					More than 300 diseases were treated with needle and moxibustion in the 1970s but the figure went up to 500. 
					
					Along with the developing science and technology, successes have been made in the field of acupuncture and moxibustion and their application methods updated. 
					
					New treatment methods have been developed with traditional acupuncture and moxibustion therapies combined with modern medicine.
					
					Research in the theory of acupuncture and moxibustion has also made progress. 
					
					It has been recognized that acupuncture and moxibustion give good effects on functional regulation, pain killing, immunity improvement, ageing prevention and health promotion. The research in the Kyongrak theory, an elementary theory of ancient medicine, and acupuncture points made clear the important role of the nerve system. 
					
					The prospect of acupuncture and moxibustion is viewed as bright.
					
					Diagnosis of acupuncture points will be replaced by apparatus diagnosis to put acupuncture and moxibustion on a scientific and modern basis. Acupuncture and moxibustion will be applied to the treatment of intractable diseases, as well as weight reduction and ageing prevention.
					
					Acupuncture and moxibustion are also used at home.

articles.title: DPRK Affected by Typhoon-9
articles.content:
\DPRK Affected by Typhoon-9
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- The west coastal areas of Korea have been affected by typhoon-9.
					
					According to information released by the Central Meteorological Research Institute, the typhoon has brought strong winds of 17 meters per second and much rain to South Hwanghae Province from 9 p.m. Sunday.
					
					North Hwanghae Province has been battered by 15m/s winds and Nampho city by 11m/s from around 00:00 Monday.
					
					With the typhoon moving northward, North and South Phyongan Provinces are likely to be hit by a heavy rain from Monday night. 
					
					The West Sea of Korea is expected to see 10-15m/s southeast winds and 4-6m waves and some coastal areas are likely to be visited by 50-70cm tidal waves.

articles.title: Downpour Caused by Typhoon-9
articles.content:
Downpour Caused by Typhoon-9
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- It heavily rained in different areas of Korea today, with typhoon-9 of 960 hpa of central atmospheric pressure moving from the West Sea of Korea at the speed of 28 km/h.
					
					The rainfall registered 125 mm in Sinchon County, South Hwanghae Province, 108 mm and 100 mm in Rinsan and Sohung counties of North Hwanghae Province and 105 mm in Sudong District of South Hamgyong Province from 00:00 to 18:00.
					
					There was downpour of over 50 mm in Sudong District from 06:00 to 09:00, in Sinchon County from 09:00 to 12:00 and in Rinsan and Sohung counties from 12:00 to 15:00.
					
					According to information released by the Central Meteorological Research Institute, typhoon which reached the central West Sea of Korea (38.4 degrees north latitude and 124.2 degrees east longitude) as of 15:00 is expected to affect Korea till August 9.
					
					It is, therefore, foreseen that it will rain 40-70 mm in North and South Phyongan and Jagang provinces, over 100 mm in some parts of those provinces, and 30-50 mm in Pyongyang, Kangwon Province and other areas, over 70 mm in some areas.
					
					It is foreseen that the typhoon will reach the land of China at 03:00 on August 9 and get weak to be low atmospheric pressure.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses S. Korean Authorities of Their Fabrication of "Spy Ring Case"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses S. Korean Authorities of Their Fabrication of "Spy Ring Case"
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- The south Korean fascist authorities' fabrication of the "spy ring case" is a premeditated plot to brutally suppress and stamp out the pro-reunification movement organizations and progressive figures incurring their displeasure by linking them to the DPRK. 
					
					Rodong Sinmun Monday observes this in a bylined commentary.
					
					Whenever the successive fascist dictators of south Korea found themselves in their extreme ruling crisis, they cooked up "spy ring cases" in a bid to divert the people's attention elsewhere and justify their suppression of progressive forces. This was the trite artifice employed by them, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					In recent years, the conservative authorities have blocked the democratic development of the society, brought the economy to ruin, deteriorated the people's living and pushed the inter-Korean relations to a total collapse through the harshest fascist dictatorial rule and escalated confrontation with the DPRK. The resentment and hatred of the people from all walks of life for them have reached the height. The "National Assembly election" and the "presidential election" are expected to take place in south Korea next year. They aim to take these elections as platforms for throwing overboard those conservative forces for having enforced a misrule quite contrary to public mind-set.
					
					Thrown into the abyss of utter isolation and ruin, they are seeking a way out of it in orchestrating a shocking "case."
					
					The south Korean public is now becoming increasingly vocal demanding the authorities make a switchover in their anachronistic "policy toward the north" as required by the trend of the times and opting for mending the inter-Korean relations. The above-said case was cooked up by the ultra-right conservative forces in south Korea who have so far stuck to the policy of escalating the confrontation under the signboard of "adhering to principles." This case is aimed to throw a wet blanket over the public calling for the improved inter-Korean relations and justify their existing stand.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Hit for Ignoring Demand for Cutting Registration Fee
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Hit for Ignoring Demand for Cutting Registration Fee
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- A deputy spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea in a commentary on August 3 denounced the authorities for ignoring the demand of the people from all walks of life for the decrease of registration fee.
					
					Some private universities in Seoul recently raised tuition for new school term to the maximum of over 10 percent, the commentary said, adding this is little short of increasing registration fee.
					
					It is adding to the sufferings of the people who are troubled by price hike, it noted.
					
					What is problematic is that the "government" and the "Grand National Party" remain a passive onlooker to this illegal act of the private universities, it charged.
					
					If the ruling forces sidestep the urgent demand of the people and gloss over the situation by taking unrealistic measures, the sufferings of the university students and their parents will increase and, accordingly, the people's resentment will mount, it warned.

articles.title: Toxic Substances Detected in Former U.S. Military Base in S. Korea
articles.content:
Toxic Substances Detected in Former U.S. Military Base in S. Korea
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- Toxic substances fatally harmful to human beings were detected in the former U.S. military base in Puphyong District, Inchon City, according to south Korean KBS on August 5.
					
					It was freshly confirmed that toxic substances including phenol, carcinogenic substance, over 20 times the tolerance limit were detected in the place where a U.S. forces' military transport corps was stationed till late in the 1970s, according to the results of soil survey conducted by an institute at the request of the Puphyong District side some days ago. Such heavy metals as lead and zinc were also detected there.
					
					Saying that dioxin, major toxic substance in defoliant, was not surveyed this time, inhabitants in Inchon called for an additional survey.

articles.title: S. Korean Intelligence Service Accused of Cooking up Conspiratorial Case
articles.content:
S. Korean Intelligence Service Accused of Cooking up Conspiratorial Case
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- The Family Movement for Realizing Democracy in south Korea held a rally on August 4 denouncing the Intelligence Service for cooking up a conspiratorial case.
					
					It was attended by staff of the magazine Minjok 21 and families of the victims of the "spy ring case" faked up by the IS.
					
					At the rally speakers accused the authorities of suppressing the magazine after carrying out a wholesale search operation against it though it has conducted legitimate press activities for national reconciliation, cooperation and peaceful reunification since its founding.
					
					Recalling that when announcing the results of investigation, the IS mentioned one time the name of this institution of the north and that of the other one the other time as evidence proving that they gave instructions to the magazine, they queried how could they trust those results. The magazine has never received such instructions and there has been no institution that issued instructions, they added.
					
					They went on:
					
					The IS banned lawyers from meeting with those concerned of the "spy ring case" and heaped invectives on them, keeping them handcuffed. Worse still, it is violating the rights of families of the detainees, charging them with linkage with the north.
					
					In a word, the above-said spy ring case is a fabrication. The lie is bound to be probed in face of truth.
					
					They demanded the authorities disband the IS at once over the conspiratorial case and fire its Director Won Se Hun.

articles.title: Japanese Politician's Remarks of Nuclear Ambition under Fire
articles.content:
Japanese Politician's Remarks of Nuclear Ambition under Fire
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- Tokyo Metropolan Governor Ishihara, an ultra-rightist politician of Japan, openly called for Japan's access to nuclear weapons at a press conference on August 5.
					
					In connection with the U.S. sub-critical nuclear test, he said it would be good for Japan to do such a test, adding Japan can conduct a mock A-bomb test within three months and it has lots of plutonium.
					
					If Japan does not become a military power, it may lose the value of its existence, he noted.
					
					His remarks have touched off accusations and concern of the international community as they fully revealed the nuclear ambition long pursued by the Japanese reactionaries in secrecy.

articles.title: Industrial Stagnation in U.S., Japan
articles.content:
Industrial Stagnation in U.S., Japan
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- New orders for U.S. manufactured goods declined 0.8 percent in June, the Department of Commerce reported Wednesday.
					
					Demand for transportation equipment plummeted 8.6 percent.
					
					Isuzu Motors Ltd. said Wednesday its group net profit in the April-June period declined 29.6 percent from a year earlier.
					
					Suzuki Motor Corp. said Wednesday its consolidated operating profit dropped 20 percent from a year earlier in the April-June quarter.

articles.title: Child Porn Cases Increase in Japan
articles.content:
Child Porn Cases Increase in Japan
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- Child porn cases are increasing in Japan, sparking off serious social issue.
					
					Police busted a record-high 649 child pornography cases involving 310 underage victims in the first half of this year, representing increases of 9.1 percent and 14.4 percent, respectively, the National Police Agency said Thursday.

articles.title: U.S. Jobless Claims 400000
articles.content:
U.S. Jobless Claims 400 000
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- The jobless issue remains serious in the U.S. due to economic depression.
					
					The U.S. Labor Department reported Thursday the advance figure for seasonally adjusted initial claims for jobless benefits was 400 000 in the week ending July 30.

articles.title: Russia Beefs up Air Force
articles.content:
Russia Beefs up Air Force
						

					Moscow, August 7 (KCNA) -- Russia is paying big efforts to bolstering its air force.
					
					The Air Force of Russia will be delivered six new "Su-34" fighter bombers this year, according to a recent report of the Russian paper Rossiskaya Gazeta.

articles.title: Nigerien President Calls for National Reconciliation
articles.content:
Nigerian President Calls for National Reconciliation
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- Nigerian President Mahamadou Issoufou called for national reconciliation in his message to the nation on the independence day on August 3.
					
					The message referred to the shining feats performed by the earlier generations to emancipate the people from colonialism.
					
					It stressed that all the people should remember their feats and reconcile with each other.

articles.title: Cambodia's GDP Growth Likely to Exceed 8 Percent
articles.content:
Cambodia's GDP Growth Likely to Exceed 8 Percent
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- Cambodia's GDP (Gross Domestic Product) is expected to grow over 8 percent this year, Cambodian Minister of Commerce Cham Prasidh said Thursday.

articles.title: Iran Combats Drug Trafficking
articles.content:
Iran Combats Drug Trafficking
						

					Tehran, August 7 (KCNA) -- Iran has paid efforts to combating drug trafficking.
					
					The police of this country seized 18 tons of varieties of drugs in the border areas including Sistanbaluchistan Province in the first four months of the year.

articles.title: 5 More NATO Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan
articles.content:
5 More NATO Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- 5 NATO soldiers in Afghanistan met deaths due to the military attacks by the resistance forces of the country on August 3 and 4.

articles.title: Chinese Official Calls for Anti-Terrorism Campaign
articles.content:
Chinese Official Calls for Anti-Terrorism Campaign
						

					Beijing, August 7 (KCNA) -- Meng Jianzhu, minister of Public Security of China, on Thursday called for striking a heavy blow to violent and terrorist acts to protect the life and property of the people and social stability.  
					
					Addressing a national anti-terrorism meeting held in Urumqi, the Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region, he appealed to all the regions and sectors to have a clear understanding of the complicated situation of the protracted anti-terrorism operation and take powerful measures for eliminating hotbeds of violent and terrorist activities.

articles.title: South Sudan Joins African Union
articles.content:
South Sudan Joins African Union
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- South Sudan joined the African Union as the 54th member nation on July 29.
					
					The African Union sent to all its member and observer nations and international organizations a notice that South Sudan became its member state.

articles.title: AU Summit to Deal with Famine
articles.content:
AU Summit to Deal with Famine
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- The African Union announced on August 1 that it is convening a summit to discuss rendering assistance to famine-stricken people in the Horn of Africa.
					
					The summit will be attended by state leaders of African countries and representatives of international donor organizations.
					
					At a meeting with AU officials, the vice-chairman of the AU called on all African nations to do every possible effort to help the famine victims.

articles.title: OPEC Daily Crude Oil Output Up
articles.content:
OPEC Daily Crude Oil Output Up
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- The daily crude oil output of the member nations of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) reached 30 367 000 barrels in July, or 607 000 barrels more than before, according to an oil market survey of Dow-Jons on August 2.
					
					The figure is a record high since November 2008.
					
					OPEC decided to limit the oil output of the member nations in late 2008.
					
					But their output this summer nearly reached the amount three years before.
					
					Dow-Jons is of the view that the situation shows the organization's quota system no longer works.

articles.title: U.N. Official Calls for Measures for Drought Victims in Horn of Africa
articles.content:
U.N. Official Calls for Measures for Drought Victims in Horn of Africa
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- The United Nations Assistant Secretary General for Humanitarian Affairs called for taking powerful and unified measures to help the Horn people of Africa recover from the drought damage.
					
					Speaking to reporters on August 1, he said the crisis should be solved urgently.
					
					12 400 000 people in the Horn of Africa are in need of aid and more people will suffer if practical measures are not taken, he stressed.

articles.title: Chinese Official Calls for Smashing Children Kidnapping
articles.content:
Chinese Official Calls for Smashing Children Kidnapping
						

					Beijing, August 7 (KCNA) -- Meng Jianzhu, Chinese minister of Public Security, called for strictly dealing with children kidnapping and traffic.
					
					Addressing a recent round-table talk held in Beijing, he said the public security organs at all levels and police should invigorate special operations against kidnapping and traffic with a sense of responsibility for the people, so as to protect children and interests of the people.
					
					The security organs should seriously review the experience gained in detecting and smashing large-scale crimes and properly carry on joint operations, he urged.

articles.title: China Calls for Intensifying Study among Party Members
articles.content:
China Calls for Intensifying Study among Party Members
						

					Beijing, August 7 (KCNA) -- The Chinese Xinhua News Agency recently called for innovating the study method among members of the Communist Party.
					
					An important thing is to develop intellectual and practical ability of cadres affiliated with the party in a systematic way with emphasis put on the economic and social development and its prospect, said the news agency.
					
					In order to raise the effect and enthusiasm of study among cadres it is important to combine study with their work, it added.

articles.title: Abkhazia Lodges Protest with U.S.
articles.content:
Abkhazia Lodges Protest with U.S.
						

					Moscow, August 7 (KCNA) -- The Abkhazian Foreign Ministry on August 1 lodged a protest with the United States against the U.S. Senate terming the Russian military presence in the country as "occupation", ITAR TASS said.
					
					The Foreign Ministry stated that Abkhazia does not agree to the view of the U.S. Senate.
					
					Abkhazia always keeps its door open for any U.S. official who wants to confirm firsthand that the country is an independent and democratic nation pursuing its own domestic and foreign politics, said the Foreign Ministry. 
					
					It expressed regret over the U.S. political and economic sanctions against Abkhazia.

articles.title: Brazil Creates Security Agency for World Cup
articles.content:
Brazil Creates Security Agency for World Cup
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian government recently created the Special Secretariat of Security as part of preparations for 2014 World Cup.

articles.title: Mongolians Demonstrate against UK Court Decision
articles.content:
Mongolians Demonstrate against UK Court Decision
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- A demonstration took place in Ulan Bator, Mongolia on Wednesday in protest against a British court's decision to hand over a senior Mongolian security official to Germany.  
					
					The protesters said Britain arrested the Mongolian official with the tactics of allurement and urged it to stop interfering in internal affairs of other countries.

articles.title: Iran's New Oil Minister Appointed
articles.content:
Iran's New Oil Minister Appointed
						

					Tehran, August 7 (KCNA) -- The Iranian parliament Wednesday appointed an Islamic Revolution Guards Corps (IRGC) official as the oil minister.

articles.title: Iran Able to Export Defense Technologies
articles.content:
Iran Able to Export Defense Technologies
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- An Iranian official said on August 1 that the country has capabilities of exporting defense technologies along with industrial and defense products, according to IRNA.
					
					Addressing a meeting of officials of the Iranian Committee of Aerospace Industry, its chairman said Iran is applying up-to-date technologies to defense products. 
					
					The qualities of the products have been improved and their exports increased despite sanctions, he said, adding that the fact shows the self-sufficiency of the committee.

articles.title: China Has Round-table Talk on Western View of Information
articles.content:
China Has Round-table Talk on Western View of Information
						

					Beijing, August 7 (KCNA) -- Chinese pressmen had a round-table talk on August 1 on the theme "False nature of Western view of information revealed by tapping scandal".
					
					Participants in the talk said the tapping scandal of the British "World News" betrays the false nature of the Western view of information activities and the intrinsic contradictions between the information theories and practice of the West.
					
					Cai Mingzhao, a vice-director of the Publicity Department of the Communist Party of China Central Committee, said the scandal clearly shows that China should steadily develop information theories suitable to socialism with Chinese characteristics and guide the Chinese media to go along the right track.

articles.title: Earthquakes Hit Papua New Guinea
articles.content:
Earthquakes Hit Papua New Guinea
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- 5.9-and 5.2-magnitude earthquakes hit New Britain area, Papua New Guinea on August 4.
					
					The epicenter was the northern waters.

articles.title: Cooperation among Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Countries
						

					Pyongyang, August 8 (KCNA) -- China and Albania on Wednesday agreed to further expand and deepen bilateral relations in the fields of politics, trade, energy resources, infrastructure and others.
					
					On the same day Brazil and Nepal signed three bilateral agreements on technical cooperation, visa exemptions for both foreign ministries' officials and political consultations.

articles.title: Flotilla china parte del puerto de Wonsan
articles.content:
Flotilla china parte del puerto de Wonsan
						

					Pyongyang, 8 de agosto (ACNC) -- Partio el dia 8 del puerto de Wonsan la flotilla de las fuerzas navales del Ejercito Popular de Liberacion de China (EPLCh) compuesta por el barco de entrenamiento "Zheng He" y la fragata "Luoyang" y dirigida por el vicealmirante Tian Zhong, comandante de la Flota del Mar Norte del EPLCh tras terminar la visita de amistad a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.

articles.title: Representacion en Phanmunjom exige revocar "Ulji Freedom Guardian"
articles.content:
Representacion en Phanmunjom exige revocar "Ulji Freedom Guardian"
						

					Pyongyang, 8 de agosto (ACNC) -- Pese a la unanime aspiracion de los nacionales y extranjeros a la paz de la Peninsula Coreana, Estados Unidos y las autoridades surcoreanas volveran a librar desde el dia 16 hasta el 26 que viene los aventureros ejercicios militares conjuntos "Ulji Freedom Guardian". 
					
					Con respecto a que se crea otra vez la crisis de guerra en la Peninsula Coreana, la Representacion del Ejercito Popular de Corea (EPC) en Phanmunjom remitio el dia 7 a EE.UU. y las autoridades surcoreanas el siguiente mensaje abierto que refleja la voluntad unanime del ejercito y el pueblo coreanos:
					
					La paz es la fuerte aspiracion e invariable demanda de nuestro ejercito y pueblo.
					
					Pero, la situacion actual de la Peninsula Coreana esta al borde de guerra tras sobrepasar hace mucho tiempo el inestable marco de armisticio que no significaba la paz ni la guerra.
					
					Esta evolucion de la situacion es producto de la politica hostil a la RPDC de EE.UU., que dice una cosa y hace la otra, y la politica conflictiva anti-RPDC de las autoridades surcoreanas que obedecen a ciegas al imperio. Al mismo tiempo, es resultado directo del cada dia mas agravante belicismo anti-RPDC del circulo militar surcoreano.
					
					"Ulji Freedom Guardian" es la continuacion de tal belicismo.
					
					Esta maniobra muy peligrosa se desarrollara segun el guion de guerra anti-RPDC enmendado y complementado nuevamente por las fuerzas belicistas de EE.UU. y de la capa militar surcoreana.
					
					Igualmente, tiene el caracter de ejercicio de guerra nuclear total porque se movilizan generalmente modernos equipos belicos, incluso los renovados medios de ataque nuclear, un gran numero de uniformados agresores y hasta los organos locales de administracion y empresas civiles del Sur de Corea.
					
					Lo peor del caso es que "Ulji Freedom Guardian" se desarrollara a sabiendas de que llegan al climax la indignacion y el animo de venganza de nuestro ejercito y pueblo por las provocaciones de gran envergadura cometidas por belicistas militares surcoreanos. 
					
					Dada esta situacion grave, bajo la autorizacion, la Representacion del EPC en Phanmunjom presenta a EE.UU. y las autoridades surcoreanas las siguientes demandas de principios:
					
					1. EE.UU. y las autoridades surcoreanas deben mostrarnos la voluntad de desnuclearizar la Peninsula Coreana con su decision politica de suspender los presentes ejercicios militares conjuntos.
					
					Si demandan a la contraparte la accion sincera por la desnuclearizacion y desarrollan por otra parte los actos de provocacion de guerra chantajeandola con el colectivo de portaaviones nuclear supergrande y la aviacion de ataque nuclear estrategico, esto significaria ya faltar al principio de accion simultanea hacia la desnuclearizacion.
					
					La desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana no es la de una parte, sino es la comprensiva e imparcial que toma en cuenta hasta la eliminacion de amenaza nuclear sobre la RPDC.
					
					El ejercito y el pueblo de Corea no ocultan al mundo que poseen, a diferencia del pasado, el fuerte disuasivo nuclear para la autodefensa.
					
					Y anuncian francamente que estan preparados para responder con armas nucleares si el rival les impone la guerra nuclear. 
					
					EE.UU. y las autoridades surcoreanas deben conocer bien la situacion en cambio y a la contraparte robustecida y demostrar a todo el mundo la voluntad de desnuclearizar la Peninsula Coreana al revocar los presentes ejercicios militares.
					
					2. EE.UU. y las autoridades surcoreanas deben tomar la decision practica de sustituir el actual sistema de armisticio de la Peninsula Coreana por el de paz, al suspender los presentes ejercicios belicos conjuntos.
					
					Son incompatibles la guerra y la paz.
					
					Seria la peor muestra de cinismo politico si incurren hasta hoy dia en la mala jugada de doble rasero como hablar mucho de la paz y dialogo por delante y preparar la guerra a las espaldas.
					
					La repeticion de ano en ano de los actos de provocacion de guerra como "Ulji Freedom Guardian" empeorara el ciclo vicioso de desconfianza y enfrentamientos y dara lugar inevitablemente a la guerra.
					
					Serian muy equivocados si piensan que estaran seguros o ilesos el territorio estadounidense y el surcoreano en el caso de que se desate la guerra en la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Tenemos la conviccion y optimismo de que si se desata la guerra en la Peninsula Coreana, perderemos unicamente la linea de demarcacion militar y buscaremos la reunificacion de la patria, maximo anhelo nacional.
					
					Si EE.UU. tiene de veras la intencion de cambiar el actual sistema de armisticio de la Peninsula Coreana por el de paz, debe exponer al interior y al exterior su voluntad practica como gran potencia, al suspender, por lo minimo, los ejercicios militares conjuntos de este ano.
					
					3. EE.UU. y las autoridades surcoreanas deben expresar oficialmente la voluntad de normalizar las relaciones con la RPDC mediante la suspension de los ejercicios militares en cuestion.
					
					La normalizacion de las relaciones comienza por el cese de actos hostiles.
					
					Si hablan hoy de la reconciliacion, cooperacion y mejoramiento de relaciones y desarrollan manana los ejercicios belicos para eliminar a la contraparte, esto sera el climax de la dualidad.
					
					EE.UU. impuso indecibles sufrimientos al pueblo coreano y las autoridades surcoreanas dejaron una herida muy profunda a todos los coreanos al echar a perder la epoca de reunificacion iniciada el 15 de junio.
					
					Sin embargo, el ejercito y pueblo coreanos estan dispuestos a sujetar lo todo a la gran empresa por la paz, la reunificacion, la reconciliacion y la cooperacion.
					
					EE.UU. y las autoridades surcoreanas no deben cometer mas el error politico de malinterpretar tal disposicion del ejercito y pueblo coreanos.
					
					En particular, si se toma en cuenta la esperanza del pueblo de que el venidero 15 de agosto (dia de liberacion de Corea) sea el nuevo punto de viraje en las relaciones intercoreanas, el inicio al dia siguiente de los ejercicios militares contra la contraparte (RPDC) significaria la negativa total al mejoramiento de esos vinculos.
					
					Francamente dicho, el que esta apretado por mejorar las relaciones no es la RPDC sino EE.UU. y las autoridades surcoreanas.
					
					La RPDC vino viviendo hasta ahora sin normalizar las relaciones con EE.UU. o las autoridades surcoreanas y seguira viviendo en mayor prosperidad.
					
					Para normalizar las relaciones RPDC-EE.UU. y las N-S, hay que publicar oficialmente la voluntad de suspender los ejercicios de guerra nuclear que toman al ejercito y pueblo coreanos como su blanco.
					
					Son invariables la voluntad y la posicion del ejercito y pueblo coreanos de responder con intransigencia a "Ulji Freedom Guardian".
					
					EE.UU. y las autoridades surcoreanas deben actuar con prudencia ante la disyuntiva de dialogo o confrontacion y de paz o guerra y tomar una opcion sensata.
					
					El ejercito y pueblo coreanos esperan la respuesta positiva a sus demandas justas e imparciales.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia fabricacion de "casos de grupo de espias"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia fabricacion de "casos de grupo de espias"
						

					Pyongyang, 8 de agosto (ACNC) -- La fabricacion de "casos de grupo de espias" en el Sur de Corea es un complot premeditado para reprimir sin piedad a las entidades de movimiento por la reunificacion y las personalidades progresistas, que no les agradan a las autoridades fascistas, vinculandolas con la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					Senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual difundido en su edicion de este lunes y continua:
					
					Historicamente, los dictadores fascistas surcoreanos inventan los "casos de grupo de espias", cada vez que se hallaban en la crisis de dominacion, para desviar la mirada de la opinion publica y justificar la represion contra las fuerzas progresistas.
					
					En estos dias en la sociedad surcoreana llegan al climax la indignacion y la colera de distintos estratos contra las autoridades conservadoras que impidieron el desarrollo democratico de la sociedad, llevaron a la quiebra la economia y la vida del pueblo y rompieron completamente las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas, practicando la dictadura fascista nunca vista y recurriendo a las maniobras conflictivas anti-RPDC.
					
					En particular, en el ano proximo se realizaran en el Sur de Corea las "elecciones de diputados a la asamblea nacional" y las "elecciones presidenciales".
					
					Los habitantes de distintos estratos esperan estas oportunidades para sentenciar a las fuerzas conservadoras que practican las politicas infames nadando a contrapelo de la opinion publica.
					
					Las fuerzas gobernantes surcoreanas buscan su salida en la fabricacion de los casos sensacionales. 
					
					En la actualidad en el Sur de Corea se alzan las voces que demandan a las autoridades cambiar la anacronica "politica sobre el Norte", de acuerdo con la tendencia de la epoca, y mejorar las relaciones intercoreanas.
					
					Pero, las fuerzas ultraderechistas surcoreanas, que vinieron persistiendo en la politica conflictiva bajo el rotulo de "mantener los principios", intentan enfriar con la fabricacion de "casos de grupo de espias" la opinion publica que demanda la mejora de las relaciones intercoreanas y justificar su posicion existente.

articles.title: Tonteria de Ishihara sobre el nuclear
articles.content:
Tonteria de Ishihara sobre el nuclear
						

					Pyongyang, 8 de agosto (ACNC) -- En una rueda de prensa del dia 5, el gobernador metropolitano de Tokio, Ishihara, politico ultraderechista japones, hablo abiertamente de la posesion de armas nucleares.
					
					Respecto a la prueba nuclear subcritica por parte de Estados Unidos, Ishihara senalo que seria bueno tambien para Japon si hace tal cosa; Japon puede hacer dentro de 3 meses el ensayo de bombas atomicas porque cuenta con gran cantidad de plutonio.
					
					Continuo que Japon perderia el sentido de la existencia si no se convierta en potente estado militar.
					
					Tales palabras demuestran patentemente la malsana intencion de los reaccionarios japoneses que vinieron persiguiendo en secreto durante largo tiempo la ambicion nuclear y causa la censura y preocupacion de la sociedad internacional.
